title: The Mad Scientist's Guide to Dating
description: Three Consortium of Chaos novellas based on classic love stories! Pride and Prejudice, Jane Eyre, and Emma are reimagined with supervillains, laser weapons, and Santa Claus’s crazy kids!Mary Meryton doesn’t fit in with the rest of her social-climbing family and she hates attending dull villains’ mixers. But having to deal with Ian Claus’ arrogance is just the last straw. He is handsome, mysterious, and terrible at conversations, yet the more she gets to know Ian, the more Mary thinks there might be more to him than she first expected.Jane Gateshead is a heroic sidekick in need of a job. Sadly, her only option left is to take work with a villain, and Professor Damascus Thornfield is hiring. Charter member of the Institute of Mad Science, he grudgingly agrees to train Jane in villainy. Unfortunately, something from the past is threatening Jane’s new life. If they’re going to have a future together, she and Damascus are going to have to face it together… and maybe battle an ooze monster.For years, Mia Hartfield has been stuck in a not-so-friendly rivalry with Deacon DeWitt. Deacon is the crown prince of successful, popular, and waaaay too handsome. Meanwhile, Mia’s only claim-to-fame is her ability to pair other criminals up with their perfect match. …Even if they don’t always appreciate her matchmaking. Now, Mia is determined to find a partner-in-crime for herself.(M/F, HEA, 107K words, no cheating, office romance, age gap romance, antihero romance, is part of a series but can be read as a stand-alone.)
author: Elizabeth Gannon
